elements.name: el1503957437440
elements.label: Hero Headline
elements.microcopy: This is the text that appears over the image at the top of the page.

elements.name: el1503957437441
elements.label: Hero Deck
elements.value: All you need to know about the Sustainable Coffee Challenge and coffee sustainability
elements.microcopy: This is the text that appears under the headline above.

elements.name: el1503957437442
elements.label: Body Text Intro
elements.value: We know that our collective vision to make coffee the world's first sustainable agricultural product depends on effectively communicating and sharing our work. These resources aim to help our partners, media and coffee lovers best understand what coffee could be.
elements.microcopy: Body text starts here. If you don't have any subheads, you can paste all of the text here; if you want to use subheads, use the following fields to break up the copy accordingly.

elements.name: el1503957437443
elements.label: Subhead 1
elements.microcopy: This is your first subhead. All of these are optional (but encouraged!)

elements.label: 2 column bulleted list 1
elements.value:
• Coalition of Over 65 Partners Agree to Collective Actions in Industry-Wide Effort to Make Coffee Sustainable, Conservation International, April 17, 2017
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge & Global Coffee Platform sign Memorandum of Understanding to drive efforts towards making coffee the first sustainable agricultural product, Conservation International, February 8, 2017
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge Announces Advisory Council Conservation International, January 17, 2017
  • New Report Uncovers Status Towards Making Coffee The World's First Sustainable Agricultural Product Conservation International, September 16, 2016
  • Rwanda and Mexico Become First Countries to Commit to Sustainable Coffee Challenge Conservation International, June 16, 2016
  • Can coffee become world’s first 100% sustainable agricultural product PRI, March 20, 2016

elements.label: 2 column bulleted list 2
elements.value:
• Sustainable Coffee Challenge Collective Action Networks Update Webinar, Conservation International, January 25, 2018
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge Renovation and Rehabilitation Guidebook and Reporting on Commitments Webinar, Conservation International, December 11, 2017
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge 100-Day Report-Out Webinar, Conservation International, September 22, 2017
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge Overview/Update and Milestones Webinar, Conservation International, June 28, 2017
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge All-Partner Meeting Reflections and Next Steps, Conservation International, April 5, 2017
  • Sustainable Coffee Challenge Introductory Webinar, Conservation International, January 26, 2017

elements.label: 2 column bulleted list 3
elements.value:
• Renovation & Rehabilitation for Resilient Coffee Farms: A Guidebook for Roasters, Traders and Supply Chain Partners
  • Coffee in the 21st century - Will Climate Change and Increased Demand Lead to New Deforestation?
  • Coffee Catalog Summary Factsheet
  • Coffee Sustainability Catalogue 2016

elements.label: 2 column bulleted list 4
elements.value:
• Unsustainable coffee? In the near future, it won’t be an option
  • Coffee’s bitter side: addressing labor conditions
  • To weather a changing climate, coffee needs bees, trees: study
  • Coalition maps the future of coffee in an uncharted climate
  • Your morning cup: now with more trees

elements.label: 2 column bulleted list 5
elements.value:
• Spanish Video: Future of Coffee
  • Panfleto: Conservemos Nuestro Cafe
